DrawbackFlow Enterprise Guide

The complete manual for managing your Duty Drawback program. From data ingestion to financial recovery, master every step of the workflow.

Broker Handshake

2 Data Management Rules

Strict Validation

The system rejects bad data *before* it enters the database. Common rejection reasons:

  • Future Dates: Import/Export dates cannot be in the future.
  • Invalid UOM: Must match whitelist (KG, PCS, M, SQM, L, etc).
  • Entry Number Format: Must contain alphanumeric characters (not just text).

Smart Fill & Warnings

Yellow cells indicate the system has auto-corrected or defaulted data.

Example:

If a UOM is missing in the upload, the system may default it to 'PCS' based on the Product Master. Always review yellow cells.

3 The Matching Engine

Strategy Selection

FIFO (Default)
First-In, First-Out. Consumes oldest inventory first. Best for compliance standard.
Maximize Duty
Prioritizes imports with highest duty paid. Best for financial optimization.

Core Calculations

  • 1
    Date Integrity Check

    The engine strictly compares Import Date <= Export Date. Any import arriving after the export is skipped.

  • 2
    Unit Conversion

    Uses Product Master to convert units.
    Formula: Export Qty * Conversion Factor = Required Import Qty

  • 3
    Financials

    Refund is calculated as: (Matched Qty * Unit Duty) * 99%. The 1% is retained by government statute.

Roles & Responsibilities

Reviewer

Audits Draft matches. Can edit refund amounts. Groups items into Claims.

Approver

audits "Reviewed" claims. Can Approve (Lock) or Return (Reject) items.

Status Glossary

DRAFT Raw match. Visible to Reviewer.
REVIEWED Grouped in Claim. Visible to Approver.
APPROVED Internally accepted. Ready for Broker.
COMPLETE Filed with Customs. Broker ID attached.
VOIDED Cancelled. Inventory Restored.

Critical: The Broker Handshake

A claim is not considered finished until you locate it in the History tab and click "Mark Final". You must enter the external Broker Claim ID (e.g., from ACE). This action stamps the final approval date and locks the record as "COMPLETE".
